{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-176-15-A
|Item_parent=Infectious diarrhoea in adults and children
|Item_parent_short=Infectious diarrhoea in adults and children
|Rank=A
|Title=Knowing the definition of a collective foodborne outbreak
|Description=See item 179
|Rubric=Definition
|Contributors=Johann Cailhol
|Order=15}}
See [[Health risks related to food and water. Food poisoning|item 179]]

properties.question: What is the correct definition of a collective foodborne outbreak?
properties.option_a: An incident where an individual experiences symptoms of food poisoning after eating at a single restaurant.
properties.option_b: A situation where multiple individuals in a community develop similar symptoms of food poisoning after consuming food from the same source.
properties.option_c: A case where a single person is diagnosed with food poisoning from a contaminated water source.
properties.option_d: A scenario where food poisoning symptoms are reported but no common source can be identified.
